Review Text: This lamp works great with routines to set a OK to wake/get up light for those with small children. Using multiple routines I’ve set it as a night light and disable the tap. I then have the morning routines ramp the green light up to signal it’s ok to get out of bed/wake. During the day the tap feature is enable and kids have fun tapping and changing colors. At bedtime our gentle wind down routine sets to white light and stays on for a set period and then dims down. We’ve always used a “OK to wake clock” and it functions fine but this gives some added features like being able to disable the morning routine if they are sound asleep and you don’t want the light to wake them.This lamp does exactly what it says it does, is well built and stable.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2019

Review Text: I bought this for fun for my youngest child. She has a dot in her room and we have set up routines on the app to have the Dot and Glow work together. She says “alexa, bedtime” and her Glow lights up to a nice blue at 50% and does an ocean blue light change. Simultaneously, her Dot will start to play thunderstorm sounds. The white light at 100% is bright enough for her to read in bed. Since she has a Dot, she can lower the brightness, change the color, change the light mode, turn it off/on and set light timers by voice. Her morning alarm is set with a routine to turn on the Glow and for her dot to play music. She also has her morning routine setup to play on her dot with various reminders and alarms and her Glow changes color for different tasks.It’s so pretty and calming with the light changing modes and will probably buy one for my room just because it’s so pretty.It would work fine with just the app or tapping it, but I recommend getting a Dot to work with it. It only took a few minutes to look up setting up routines and even my child can set up routines with the app for both devices to get them to function in the way she would like. It’s also fun for her to set the rainbow timer for things like straightening her room or staying on task. It’s a very simple product with a large amount of options as a stand alone and unlimited options with the app and a dot. I would love to see move amazon light items in their upcoming selection.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2020

Review Text: When I saw the Echo Glow I had the idea that an Echo-controlled RGB sphere on my desk might be a great way to relay information at a glance using routines to set the state of the light. My idea was something like: exterior door opens, set brightness 50% + set color red. I can report that (at least with devices linked through SmartThings) the reaction time is far too slow to be useful - often more than 20 seconds. For comparison, a hue bulb linked to SmartThings can change color in response to an event in just a couple seconds. You may have better luck if you're using an echo with a built-in zigbee hub to control your smart devices.That said, the light is soft and pleasant, the colors are bright and vibrant (with the possible exception of the blue), and the 'campfire' mode really does illuminate like a small campfire in a dark room. Overall, if you're buying this for the intended purpose you won't be disappointed.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2019

Review Text: I love the idea of this light. My 3 year old son loves it. I like the tap function (just tap the top of the light), to change colors. This can also be disabled in the Alexa app if you want to keep it one color.I love the color modes. There are several to choose from like fire truck, which is red and orange, underwater which is greens and blues, siren which is red and blue, color flow, which goes through all the colors, and several others.Now my gripe- Alexa can not recognize some of the color modes to save her life- mainly color flow. She says she doesn’t know the color 3. I have said it as clear as I can and so have others. I have to use the app on my phone to change it to this mode, which of course is my son’s favorite. I hope they’ll do an update to fix that. I also hope they’ll add more patterns!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2021

Review Text: I bought this to replace a lamp next to my bed. It’s less than 5 inches in diameter...it could fit in the palm of an adult’s hand. I guess it’s size makes it good for a child’s bedroom but if they made this slightly bigger, I think more adults would be willing to buy it. I like its brightness at 100% and the colors are good for winding down at night.I feel it’s a bit too sensitive at times. I don’t have a nightstand, I have a small rectangular table next to my bed. It’s not flimsy but isn’t heavy either. If I bump the table with the tap feature on, it’ll change colors on me...yet at the same time, I have to kinda slap the Glow to get it to change colors. I may just need more time to get used to it. I don’t want to disable the tap feature.I also wish Alexa was integrated into it with a speaker. For my purposes I had to buy an Echo Flex to go in my bedroom as my Dot is in my living room. I’m happy that I bought the Flex as I can now use Alexa as a supplementary alarm clock...but it makes more sense to me for the Glow to have it already built in. I spent $55 for the Flex and the Glow. I would’ve been willing to pay that amount if it meant getting a Echo Glow with a speaker...maybe call it Echo Shine? Echo Beam? Echo Beacon? LOL
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2020

Review Text: Okay, so I wanted to post an update to my original review (shown below)... First off--THANK YOU to Amazon's tech support for your fantastic service. I had planned to call tech support to see if there were any ideas as to how to fix the problem described below but before I got to it THEY CALLED ME! On Sunday afternoon no less. Clearly Amazon pays close attention to the reviews people post. Their first call gave me some suggestions to try and said to get back in touch if they didn't work. Well they didn't work so I planned to call the next day but ran out of time. Then before I could get to it the next day THEY CALLED ME AGAIN! At this point I was utterly dumbfounded by the incredible level of customer service being provided--I mean really, who does this? Anyway during the second call we did finally manage to trouble shoot the problem and get it working. The solution we found was that there was a needed firmware update that wasn't happening due to my router not being pointed to Google's DNS servers (8.8.8.8) -- something I normally do right away with a new router but as the eero routers came in the midst of Christmas, I just hadn't gotten that done. So once the router was pointed at Google's DNS servers I had to unplug all the routers except the primary one attached to my ISP modem. At that point the update happened quickly, the glow started working correctly, I brought all the other routers back online and moved the glow to it's final position and it continued working properly. It has been working properly for several days now without issue so I think we can safely say, "problem solved." Hallelujah! Oh, and to top it off, Amazon called back again the next morning to verify that the glow was still working properly! Wow. Just wow.So in the end, I'm moving my rating from 1 star to 4 stars. The customer service was 5+ stars. However I still have to ding the device just a little because the problem was caused by the glow needing an update it couldn't get because of a compatibility issue with my router's default settings. I'd normally let this slide but in this case the router (an Amazon Eero) and the device (an Amazon Echo Glow) were both brand new and arrived on the same day from the same company (Amazon) and yet for some bizarre reason were incompatible until I manually repointed the DNS server address. That seems like a somewhat dumb oversight and has to dock the rating at least a star.That said, the device works, my daughter is elated, and I look like a hero in her eyes. So, yeah, Amazon's technical assistance absolutely rocks! Thanks!----------This is just a totally defective product. Got it for my 7 year old daughter for Christmas and she loved the idea but the REALITY of it made her want to cry and me want to crush it with a rock.Set up was a breeze and for the 5 or 10 minutes that it worked, it was fun. But then every time she’d ask Alexa to change the light we’d hear “Echo Glow is not responding.” I checked our eero app to see if it was online and I could see it continually connect and disconnect from wifi over and over. Amazon says to just unplug it and plug it back in and it will reconnect—FALSE! It NEVER reconnects so you have to go into the Alexa app on your phone and delete the device and then manually set it up again. I did this no less than 20 times on Christmas and every time it would stop responding after a few minutes. So I decided it must be a defective unit and requested an exchange.A week later we had a new echo glow. I set it up and everything seemed to work just fine. Until... “Echo Glow is not responding.”  Same exact thing. So this time I decided maybe it just has really lousy WiFi antennae so I moved a router into the same room about 10 feet away and set it up again. Everything worked fine... for 7 minutes and then, “Echo Glow is not responding.”At this point I can definitively say that this is a systemic problem and this product is just absolute junk. Thanks for that Amazon! Please in the future, before you release a product specifically target at kids, try a little harder to make sure it’s not junk. I cannot even begin to understand how this product has anything but 1-star reviews. Oh and for anybody that may think it’s just user error, I should tell you that I’ve worked in IT for over 10 years with 3 major corporations and a major research university. Pretty sure that I am not the problem.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020

Review Text: I was really excited to get this lamp. But after about 20 minutes of trying to make it do ANYTHING other than simply turn on and off, I packed into back into the box and I’ll be returning it.I wanted it for my son’s room for a bedtime light show and a “green means go” for him to know when he can get out of bed. I could not figure out how to do it. I tried all types of different voice commands, but couldn’t figure it out. It shouldn’t be that difficult!There’s no easy way to control the brightness either. If you tap it, it’s automatically 100% bright, which is blinding!The lamp itself is very cute and the colors are nice.But it does not do what it promises it would do, at least not very easily!I’m super disappointed, and wonder if it will get better with some time, but I’m not gonna waste my money to wait for it to improve.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2019

Review Text: This is a nice little enhancement to an echo-based on home - take the lower star reviews with a grain of salt. Those folks were expecting to get a full echo device for a relatively low price. The title and description are fairly clear in my view about it being a complimentary device. The price is also in line with cost of most multi-color LED smart bulbs with the added feature of built in power. My daughter really likes having it as a night light and reading light and likes changing up the colors. The only reason I’m only giving four stars is that Alexa isn’t quite as flexible with the command of this device yet. You have to request actions with the right phrasing she’s expected. With the more seasoned devices you can ask things multiple ways and she’s usually able figure out what you want. You do have to name it, but again this is standard for all smart lights and bulbs. They have unique identifiers so that you turn them on and off individually. You can also add this device to a larger light group to command the whole group at once.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2019

Review Text: Concept is great. Device could be awesome if it would stay connected. It works for a while, then becomes unresponsive. Factory reset doesn't help. No other wifi problems with tons of smart devices, including echos, throughout the house. Just this silly thing not wanting to be responsive. Terrible when you have a youngster that wants to try it out and instead it's become a non interactive light since alexa says the glow isn't responding more than it is responding. Amazon, test your products a bit more please. QA is worth every penny to get quality.

Review Text: Even after a solid hour trying to set this up (the instructions are simple but it failed without explanation dozen of times before suddenly just working), this “smart” light just doesn’t work.Occasionally, and I mean very rarely, it will respond to voice commands or adjustments on the app. But the rest of the time, all you get is “device not found”. I know it must be set up right because once in a while it does work. But for the vast majority of the time, it simply doesn’t work.I have many Alexa devices, I love them and know how to make them work. But Amazon has no business selling a product like this that just isn’t ready for sale.In the end, all this is is a basic night light. And you don’t have to pay $30 for a basic night light. Very disappointing.Avoid.

Review Text: My son loves this light. All the options for colors are great and he can change it from bed since he has an Alexa flex in his bedroom.Love the scheduling. Review Text: Prior to receiving an Echo Show 8 as a Christmas gift our smart devices in our home were primarily that of the "other" company. Switching from one interface to another was a breeze. Different, but an easy adjustment as we were heavy Amazon users anyway.After receiving our echo show and seeing this item on sale it seemed like the perfect addition for our toddler who has loved interacting with Alexa. I'm not at all let down with the fact that it does not have voice integration, we actually prefer it this way so that our daughter cannot control it on her own.All in all this thing works great for our 3 year old daughter who tends to do well with a schedule and specific instructions. If the light is red, stay in bed. If the light is green, you're allowed to get up. She caught on immediately and loves to watch the different color settings throughout the day.My only let down thus far is the use of the routines. It seems pretty straight forward to create the routine if you're at all familiar with IFTT technology but somewhere along the line it does not seem to be doing what I've instructed it to do. The scheduled routine rolls around and there is a color shift, but not to the appropriate color or the brightness is at 100% when the routine clearly says something much much lower. We've only had it 3 days so at this point I'm still assuming user error somewhere along the line.I will update my review once my scheduling issue has been resolved.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2021

Review Text: My girls love these. I ordered them before they were available. They love the different light modes, especially "campfire" and "rainbow".My oldest was using a tot-clock to know when it was time to get out of bed, or when nap time/quiet time was over. I set up a couple Alexa routines for changing the color to indicate that she's free to leave her room in the morning or after nap.I have two complaints, and they affect me every day. They might be with Alexa rather than the light but they still affect how the light is used.1. If I want the light to turn off after 15 minutes I have to say a VERY specific phrase: "Alexa, set a 15 minute sleep timer on [child's name]'s lamp." So annoying! To do something that I should be able to say "Alexa, turn off [name]'s lamp in 15 minutes" Please, Amazon, fix this!!!2. After I set a sleep timer, the lamp loses whatever mode it was in and goes directly to solid color white. So my youngest daughter likes to fall asleep to the campfire mode. I have to set the sleep timer on the lamp, wait 10-45 seconds for it to turn white, then set the mode to campfire again. SO ANNOYING!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2020

Review Text: Update on 8/4/20: One day I tried to turn it off and instead put it into setup mode. Since then, my Alexa app always says that the light is unresponsive and it will no longer do what I tell it to. Somehow we got it to where it now just blinks different blue colors when it is plugged in, but it won't do anything else and will not sync to Alexa.Original review:This needs worked on. I am very happy with the price. I got this for a special deal of just $5. But I would not be happy if I paid full price. This thing doesn't work very well. If you have the tap on, it changes colors all the time without you touching it. My son goes to bed with it on a certain color and he keeps waking up in the morning with the color changed to green. I do like the special modes it has, but those can't be activated using Alexa. I have to manually go through the app to activate them. Alexa always tells me she can't do that. I hope they work on this product and fix all the glitches.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2020

Review Text: This is a fun little light. It will fit anywhere a 4th gen echo dot will fit. It shows up nicely in Alexa, but it has no ability to choose a color on a slider. It has some preset options and seems to respond to most color names that work on other smart lights. I have it set up in a routine that turns it on when I turn the alarm off, which is fun. It's handy to have a light and compact smart light that I can sit on a small adhesive mount shelf.That said, if you're buying this at full price there may be other small smart lights out there that serve you better, and the fun modes like ocean and campfire might not be worth paying more money for the same or less functionality. The timer is something that could easily be done with smart bulbs if Alexa's software allowed it. I know this because at first the name of my glow was similar to the name of the smart bulb in my room and they did everything together including timers, which would be cool if you could do it on purpose.Anyway, I like the little light and it's super easy, but a little bit of effort with a smart light app would probably get you similar if not better results. If the small size and no effort Alexa integration matter to you, though, it might be just what you want. I do think you should wait for a sale, though.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2021

Review Text: I read the description when I purchased this, so I was not disappointed to find that it has no speaker.  Totally love that it has a decent glass dome and not some plastic crap!  The size is nice...not too small, not too big.  I did not by this for a child,  it was for me to have a gentle wake up in the morning.  Sound alarms (even music) just startle me way too much and this little light works perfectly!I had some trouble starting it, but customer help at Amazon is great and it was soon working.  I have not had any of the issues that others have had with it not staying connected.  Set the wake up time by the Echo, that also shares the same room with this light, and it has done its job waking me up everyday.  Just in case the light alone doesn't wake me up...  there is a sound alarm once it reaches its brightest light level (about 15 minutes to do so).  So far, just the light itself has been enough to do the job wonderfully.As to the campfire setting... its disappointing.  It flickers, but not too realistically.  Rainbow is cool, but really wish this light could do some other effects.  How about the flickering blue of being under the ocean?  Maybe even some night time stellar effect of stars?  Hopefully we will see Amazon develop this light to do more in the future!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2019

Review Text: UPDATE TO ORIGINAL RAGE-FILLED REVIEW:All of my troubles were due to how sensitive the "touch" function is.  This night-light is on a bed-stand with a white-noise machine (Dreamegg D1).  If the white noise machine is on, the light is non-stop sensing "touches" and just cycles colors over and over no matter what you tell it to do.  Now that I have figured this out I have just disabled "touch" in the app and things are fine.  Would be nice to be able to adjust touch sensitivity as it seems a bit overkill on it's responsiveness.ORIGINAL RAGE-FILLED SLEEP DEPRIVED DAD REVIEW:This thing is absolutely terrible.  It has 1 job, which is to be a night light, and it can't even do that reliably.I put it in my infants room so I can have some red-light to feed her at night-time.  No matter how you turn it on (phone app vs. voice through my other alexa devices) it just turns her bedroom into a rainbow dance party.  SUPER HELPFUL AT 3AM!Literally every other smart-bulb in the world can do this properly...yet Amazon can't make an amazon device to function in it's amazon echosystem.It's buggy as hell, and even if they manage to update it, I still have wasted my life trying to troubleshoot it, and had it wake up a sleeping baby....it's a zero star product at best.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2019

Review Text: I bought this in July but just opened the box & set it up yesterday - bc I'm a habitual procrastinator 😕.It was super quick & easy to set up - provided you already have the Amazon app installed & have set up/used other Alexa devices so that you know what youre doing - and even if you don't; the directions are super easy.And it responds well to my Echo Show5.My only complaint (at this time) is that it keeps turning up the brightness all by itself. Like, all on its own when no one was even talking at all. I sat there and watched it turn the brightness up as far as it could when I was sitting there silently & my daughter was sleeping. So yeah, kinda irritating bc my daughter doesn't need her room all lit up at midnight. Its done this 3 times so far. And bc I would have interrupted the white noise playing on our Echo Show5, if I had asked Alexa to dim it, I had to move it from the nightstand to under the bed (I didnt want to unplug it & possibly have to set it up again or end up with the issue I'm having after I unplugged my lamp for a few minutes before plugging it back in - now, it responds fine if I manually turn it off/on using the Alexa app on my phone but when I ask Alexa to do it; she continually says my lamp "isnt responding".....but it works just fine if I physically turn it on/off in the app. 😠.....so yeah, didnt want to have that happen with this too so its gone under the bed 3 times now 😕  I'll update if I ever get an answer as to why its doing this.But other than that its pretty cool. ✌
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2021

Review Text: This light is cute, has multiple color options, modes, and timers. I’m using this as a night light for my daughter and I’ve set it up through the Alexa app. Unfortunately, even though every routine is set up to be at 5% brightness, it keeps shifting to 100% in the middle of the night. It will light the room up brighter than a100watt lamp. I wanted something that would turn on at 7:00 so my daughter would know when to wake up. It’s keeping her awake. My husband unplugged it several times when it’s super bright, which means I have to set it up all over again. After the 10 min set up and I’ve checked to make sure all the “routines” are 5% brightness, it’s at 100% again this morning. 🤦🏻‍♀️Update: Amazon customer service to the rescue! A very nice woman called at an inconvenient time and at my request called me back an hour later. Very much appreciated. She taught me a simpler way to set up a routine. I have come to the conclusion that the light was being changed manually by a small child, (not a huge surprise) who will not be rewarded unless the light changes green on its own. The app is a bit complicated and takes a little getting used to, but if you already have Alexa stuff, you’ve probably already got that part figured out. This was my first Alexa item. Hopefully I’ve got all the kinks worked out. Thank you to the very patient customer service rep that called me back and helped me get everything figured out!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2020

Review Text: I have wifi that toggles between 2.4GHz and 5GHz. Naturally, I didn't know to look or think to look what kind of wifi requirements this thing has before purchasing it for my son as a birthday gift, because my Echo Dot was set up on my home wifi effortlessly. Well, that's not the case with this. I have been on the phone with Amazon and my internet provider for hours trying to get the wifi configured so that I could set up this thing, and it's been unsuccessful. I think that it's absolutely ridiculous that you have to have specific internet requirements to hook this thing up, especially when I already have an Alexa device set up and this thing is just a glorified nightlight that does a few tricks. I was going to return it, but decided to keep it since it does still do what I had originally purchased it for. However, my son and I are now both really disappointed that we can't connect it to the Dot and make use of the Glow a little more easy. As if having his birthday in the middle of a pandemic without family and friends around wasn't disappointing enough. Thankfully I got a deal on this and only paid $10.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2020

Review Text: We bought Echo Glow as a part of a bundle deal for our 5 year old kids.  Even though the product is designed with a minimalist approach and looks simple to use, the issues are in coordination of it with Alexa app.  It seems like the product was created and then as an afterthought the decision was made to put it in the app.  For example if you want to set up an alarm, that is done in the alarms section.  But if you want it to glow on a countdown every night, then you need to set up a routine which is another function.  When you are setting up the routine, there is no separate section for echo glow but rather you need to dig into the manuals to see that you need to go to "Smart Home" and then "lights" section to find it... All of these deviations are very confusing and hard to decipher and put together for the lamp to work properly.  Sometimes we noticed the lamp just simply does its own thing and we have no idea why since there is no clear feedback mechanism set up in alexa app... With all that said, I understand that its not exactly the product's fault, however since it so heavily needs to rely on the app to function properly the result is still lackluster.  Kids love to tap it though and it changes color, or during a dance party it glows different colors.  I would say the integration is the weakest point that needs to be revamped in alexa app.  Finally, if you don't plan to connect the lamp to any network or app, then it works great, just don't expect much of it :)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2020

Review Text: This lamp has a lot of potential, if Amazon adds more flexibility in the future. It's just ok as a lamp. As a timer or alarm, it leaves a lot to be desired.Rainbow mode is nice (where the lamp changes color every few seconds.). But it can't be used in alarm mode. And the alarm sound comes from your Echo device, not the lamp. So if they're on opposite sides of the room, it's kind of weird.As for timer mode, sure, the colors change as the time approaches, but what color means what? Does blue mean five minutes to go? Ten minutes? Nobody knows.I was hoping to be able to set a recurring alarm every afternoon in rainbow mode to remind me to get dinner going, but this device can't do that. At least I got it on sale.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2019

Review Text: I bought this for a programmable nightlight.  I didn't want any listening devices in my kids room, just a nightlight that I could set brightness and have it auto off.It is fantastic at this.  It is the best night light I have found and nothing else is close.  You can adjust the percentage down by small increments.  I set 1 of them at 6% and one at 10% because my one daughter likes it brighter.Alexa routines are great. Although I hate how alexa does routines.  I would like it organized better, like the routines nested under the device or grouped by device.  You create a routine to turn it on and a separate one to turn it off.  I would imagine this has a use case, but for simplicity I would like it grouped.Now, I can see how some people might like it nested with a built in alexa.  Amazon should probably offer it both ways because I can see some people wanting an alexa with a night light built in.If you want a night light that works great, this is your device.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2019

Review Text: We purchased this for my 2 year old son, who is in need of a night light/ok to wake sort of thing for his room. There is no 'on/off' switch on this thing, and it doesn't have a built in mic like most Alexa items (which i knew when purchasing), but I didn't realize until after setting up and using how inconvenient these missing features would be. I hate having to find my phone to simply turn it off if we are done using it for the day, or to go to the Alexa on the other side of the house to ask it to turn it off.  My kids do like the fun colors it changes too, but it is just too much of a hassle to make these changes in this manner for us.  I will keep my eye on future versions of this item as it evolves and becomes more user friendly.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2020

Review Text: I have read a lot of reviews and I don't think people really read about the light let alone even just looked at the picture of the light WITH the ECHO DOT. Everyone kept saying that it doesn't have a microphone, well no it doesn't because it is paired with an Alexa Dot, Spot, or Show. When you add the Echo light through the Alexa app to your devices you give it a name, you then tell Alexa which is your Dot, Spot, or Show, to turn "Red" which is the name of mine, ON, or OFF, or what color you want it to be, etc....that is how it works. You must follow the little 3 page booklet to get it added to your devices and get the wifi added. It was simple once I figured it out. And there is a UPC type code on the back of the little booklet that must be scanned at one point. Also have your wifi password handy and a name for your light picked out. My son was amazed and loved that he could control it using Alexa. The colors of the lights are beautiful and vibrant. I do recommend it as usage for light. We keep it bedside for a low glow at night incase we have to get up. Haven't tried the timer yet. I got lucked up with a special deal that was going on for 9.99, it was worth it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2021

Review Text: Pros: My 6 year old daughter is a bit scared of the dark and would need her door wide open with a light on full brightness in our hallway. After 1 night with this light, she now likes to keep all the lights off except her new echo glow, which she has named "Star" (trademark pending, per my daughter). She loves to change the colors each night to the one she prefers. She loves all of the color combos, but in particular she likes the Valentines and the Underwater gradient color schemes. Lastly, we created we created a couple routines for my daughter that have been really successful. We created a bedtime routine so when my daughter says "Goodnight Alexa" it will turn off all her bedroom lights, turn her echo glow on at 20% brightness and the color she prefers, Alexa will say a custom message we created for her and lastly, Alexa will open Storytime and tell her a bedtime story. So far, she has used Storytime every night since Christmas and has fallen asleep in her own bed without any fights or tears.A couple other Pros for this product are the ability for kids to ask Alexa questions to learn, listen to kid friendly music, play fun games that get your kids up and moving (freeze dance, etc..). In addition, my daughter is also calling Grandmom and Grand Pop to chat as well with the Echo Dot we added with this.Cons: The only cons are that if you child is not at the right age for this device, it may prove frustrating at times. This is only due to Alex trying to decipher kid talk when they enunciate. At 6 years old, my daughter doesn't have much trouble at all. Another con could be that this is yet another device that does pull kids away from everyday life of playing outside, with friends and of course actually having some exercise. This is a given though and as a parent, the parental controls can really help limit how much the device is used. Don't get me wrong, there is no like Iphone addiction or anything with this, but it is in the back of my mind to review how much time she uses it.  The last Con would be that this is a device that does have tons of microphones. If you where a tin foil hat and these mics would bother you, then you will probably not enjoy this much.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2020

Review Text: As someone who suffers from insomnia and from constantly waking up during the night, the decision to purchase this lamp was brilliant (pun absolutely intended). Review Text: EDIT 2: The light changes when a cabinet door closes, a cat jumps on the counter, the dishwasher closes, etc. Still, the sensitivity needs a tweak.*************EDIT: I purchased several to serve as under cabinet kitchen lights. They work better than I had hoped. I use Command Velcro strips to hold them up. Also, I created a group in Alexa and can adjust all of them simultaneously. Raising to five stars for the amazingly versatile under cabinet kitchen light that hasn't caused a fire. The halogen predecessors began smoking shortly after installation. Yikes! Echo Glow is so much better!************We have so much fun with these! Disco mode causes universal groaning. My tween loves to prank her father by switching the color and/or mode as he readies himself for sleep. Finally, the green glowing Echo looks like "aliens" may have invaded our house if you are peering from the street. Giggle.However, if your light shares a desk with other items, the color changes with the slightest vibration on the desk (e.g. gently placing a cup of tea on the desk). This is frustrating especially if you prefer a particular light frequency for your current task.Although my husband has no complaints, I would prefer the device emit significantly more light at 100%. I had hoped these would replace table lamps, but they need brighter bulbs before that is an option.Good, but not yet great.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2020

Review Text: This could be a great little lamp if it worked correctly all of the time. We will set the brightness and mode and it will automatically switch it to something completely different after a few minutes. We wanted to use it as a nightlight and a fun light and it is useless as a nightlight since it randomly switches itself to 100% brightness in the middle of the night, waking our two year old in a panic. The modes are really neat and fun, you can choose a solid color as well as the brightness which are all features we like. It can be put in routines with the echo (we have echo dot kids edition) which makes for fun morning and night routines. If they work out the kinks of it just randomly doing whatever it wants then it will be a great little light.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2020

Review Text: I use it for having light on when getting ready for bed or when reading. Son didn’t want it but doesn’t understand it. I love the different brightness and different colors. Review Text: I'm a big fan of the Amazon Alexa ecosystem.  I've at least tried most of their devices.  I had a need for more light in a bedroom in the house, and when I saw this, I decided to give it a whirl.In fairness, I probably should have read reviews more carefully, or at least paid more attention to this being called a light for a kid.  It is easy to set up.  The color changing is pretty cool.  Unfortunately, even at its brightest, this thing doesn't produce much light.  In a small basement bedroom (11' x 11', maybe?), when set in a corner, it doesn't provide enough light for me to even be able to see the opposite corner of the bedroom.As a kid's night light, it's great.  It's just not useful as a normal light.  I'd find it more useful it provided more illumination and could just be turned down for use as a night light.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2021

Review Text: I got this on an amazon deal and I am so glad! I love it! I like to be able to see in the bathroom at night so I need some light. My husband likes it dark. This makes us both happy. It was very easy for the to set up and connect. I am a bit tech challenged and have had difficulty with the echo dot and other techy stuff, so this was great. It just connected and was very easy to set up.There are 12 different mode functions for the type of light. Campfire, Christmas, Firetruck, Underwater, Valentine's, Kwanzaa, Hanukkah and Siren, that all slowly flash between 2 or 3 colors. Campfire flashes with red, orange and yellow. Valentine's are pinks and purples. Christmas is red, green and white. Underwater is various blues. Siren flashes between red and blue, like a police car. I cannot remember Kwanzaa and Hanukkah.There is also color flow, where all the colors slowly flow from one to another. The Disco mode is similar but instead of flowing smoothly, they change like they would if the lights were shining off a disco ball, so more of a flash effect.I am not sure what the mood light mode does. I think it goes between the more subtle colors at a lower glow.I use the solid color setting. I have it set to blue at 5% and it is perfect. Dark enough it doesn't bother my husband but bright enough that at 2 am when I have to use the bathroom I can see where the soap is.I really like that can pick the color and the brightness of the light, so if you want a bright light you can have that and if you want a very dim light, that is easy to get too.The only thing I don't like is trying to set a routine so the light automatically comes on at a certain time and then turns off at a certain time. The first time I tried this, the max I could make the light go on for was 4 hours, which is not long enough. The next time I couldn't remember what I had done and could only set the routine to turn the light on at 9 pm. I have yet to figure out how to turn it off. I wish that part was easier. I do like I can tell my echo dot to turn the light on and off. That is nice.Overall, it is awesome. My kids want one for their rooms. They would have the most fantastic dance parties with the disco light and music blaring.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2020

Review Text: I absolutely love my new echo glow.  I set it up with my Alexa Tap, though it will work with a dot, or another Alexa device. I use it to alert other family members when I am zooming while working at home during Covid times.  I place it on the floor at the edge of the door and when it is time to zoom, I just say, "Alexa, turn on the zoom light." She turns on to whatever color I want (or the last color viewed), and my family knows to be quiet in the area and not come in for a conversation.  It is small enough to not stick out into the hallway but definitely large enough to attract everyone's attention.  When we all go back to work (we will, right?) it can be used as a night light, something to light the stairs at night, or a thousand other things.  For $29.99, it can't be beat.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2020

Review Text: I finally installed this for my little 3 year old niece. She was delighted with it. It is very simple and basic, but she is happy with that so I am happy! She was very excited to have an alarm set for 8 am and to wake up to the pretty color yellow with it. I will have to find out how that went over this morning. I left it on Color Flow for her and we chose a color for each member of the family! I told her when the light is green, it means Auntie is thinking about her. We gave dad purple, the dogs got blue and yellow, and Elsa, the omnipresent fictitious character in her world, got white. We even assigned a color for her angel grandparents. So, my niece chose crimson. She cannot really get her mind around the color name though. My only real issue is that pink is not a color in the repertoire.... little girls want and need pink and do not get it when they ask for it (Insert image of disappointed child here). The lamp has a pink color, however, being that it is named crimson she will need to expand her knowledge of the color spectrum. She is a quick study and she certainly needs to learn new things all of the time... however, it is a simple nightlight, so it would have been easier to just name the pink color pink. Otherwise, it is a pretty and fun little device. I think the price point is a bit high given its simplicity, but it is not insurmountable. I like that the Glow was easy to install. It made my niece smile and that is priceless!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2020

Review Text: Works exactly as I expected, just a smart night light for kids Bedroom. Review Text: I want to love this lamp but I can’t given it’s limited functionality. I bought it knowing it was just a lamp - but a smart lamp. It changes colors and amuses my toddler. She loves the rainbow mode and I think campfire looks really cool in a dark room. So as nothing more than a light that changes colors, it is pretty neat and a good bargain. However, the two features I bought it for are not great. First, the rainbow timer: I assumed you’d set the rainbow timer for say 10 minutes and it would change colors, then at the end of 10 minutes the light would go out. Nope. At the end of the timer the light stays on and your echo timer just goes off.  So basically it is just the light on rainbow mode and the timer doesn’t really integrate with the lamp. Second, the wake up light alarm: I assumed this would be like the sunrise feature on the echo show 5 and that the light would start out dim and gradually get brighter until the alarm time. Nope. At one minute before the alarm time the light cuts on set at white light and full brightness. No gradual brightening at all. So basically it’s just turning the light on. Because kids love to be awakened to jarring bright lights. My takeaway is that amazon really needs to give way more information in their product descriptions and maybe even include videos of the products working because that would have changed my mind about buying this particular lamp.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2019

Review Text: I ended up getting this randomly as a deal of the day for very cheap. Prior to seeing the advertisement I never heard of it. My daughter LOVES IT! The features are super cool with the different colors you can pick for it including an underwater setting that changes variations of blue and green, Valentine’s which is variations of red, and a whole lot more including it changing a rainbow of colors though that could be a bit distracting for your child trying to go to bed. Some other cool features is setting up voice codes with Alexa. When I say “Alexa bedtime” it activates the light to go on. One of my favorite features has to be setting a time for a light to turn green so they know it’s time to wake up or okay to come and wake me up. There’s probably a slew of other features as well but those are the main ones I use daily. If you’re looking for a great Smart nightlight with options look no further!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2020

Review Text: I was originally looking to buy a WiFi Alexa-enabled plug, a dimmer switch, a lamp and bulbs.  And then I found this.  More features, much cheaper.  It's great for our son's room, we can use it to help him soothe to sleep, and we can get a little more light out of it when we need to do a midnight diaper change, much easier than the full-brightness of the overhead light.The installation was a pain.  I had to accept some extra terms of service which was only available through Amazon.com so it took me out to a browser and I had to use one-time passwords and change my password twice before I was able to accept the terms and then go back in.  For a couple of days it kept asking me to complete the setup but then it finally figured out that the setup was complete.The only thing I don't like is that I haven't figured out how to set a timed-fade-out in Routines.  Since music has to be the last item in the Routine, I can't use a wait and power-off command in a music+lights routine to help him get back to sleep.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2020

   I bought this for my 8yr old who still hasn’t grown out of using a night light. He absolutely loves it! You can sync the device to your Alexa app using the barcode on the back of the instructions manual. Once complete you can set it to one of multiple solid colors or have it run through a range of different ones. The colors also change when you gently tap the device. You can also sync this device with your Alexa home security devices so that they turn on and off while you are away from home in order to deter burglars. Keep in mind that in order to control the device by voice, you have to have another Alexa compatible device such as the Echo Dot or Echo Plus. This does NOT work with Echo Flex.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2021

Review Text: As shown in the photo, I have 2 of these Echo Glows set up in my bedroom near my Echo Show 5. I can tell my Alexa to turn them on and off with relative ease, and they look really great and bright. However these lights are not without flaws. My biggest complaint is how I can’t combine both of these glows into ONE light so I can just tell Alexa to turn it on and they’ll both come on (I set up a routine so that when I say “color on/off” it toggles their power but they’d still be better combined). It would also be easier to sync up their color in one command instead of two, or one click instead of like 8 in the Alexa app. I also don’t think the tap to change color feature is practical, and I turned this feature off on both of them, as sometimes they would change color if I was simply walking around my room (too sensitive). I also wish I could set the Glows to any color of my choice using some sort of color wheel, like the Philips Hue bulbs have. Another nice feature would have been music responsiveness, like if the colors changed or flared with the beat of music played through my Alexa device. P.S. A quick note to the marketing team ;) marketing these lights to kids is also kind of a misfire because mood lights are very “in” right now with people of all ages.All in all a pretty cool product, and pretty affordable, but a little more work should have gone into both the hardware and software. Perhaps an update soon?
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2021

Review Text: UPDATE:  Amazon did reach out to me, but that went NOWHERE. I received an email and a phone call from someone that sounded like she wanted to help.  After some back and forth, she went radio silent and I didn't hear back.  So I replied to her email again and asked for an update.  I received a reply from a completely different Customer Support person who told me I should call in and open a support ticket.  I told that person "no thanks" because I've already spent WAYYYY to much time trying to get your product to do something that (although advertised as a feature...) it obviously cannot do.  I guess it will have to be a mood light because it is impossible to use this thing as a sunrise alarm.I have tried every way under the sun to create a routine that turn this thing on in the morning at a 0% brightness and the ramp it up to 100% over 30 mins.  It doesn't work.  It either turns on at 100% or 0% and stays there.  No ramp.  It also changes its color completely at random.  Hopefully Amazon patches this thing.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2019

Review Text: This product is very... "Routine" oriented. Never got into them, now I'm forced to learn, quickly.Alexa voice control - powers on, changes colors, and types. Check.Timer function - Lacking, severely.Parental control - Understood, but seriously. More adults are going to buy this for themselves than for kids. It is a glowing orb!Turning it off - kind of a joke unless you have your phone or want to yell across to your Echo device.Routines - Forced, at least it feels that way. Created a bedtime routine, Lights off, Glow on color green, wait 10mins turn Glow off, and then turn thunderstorm sounds on... now, because the Thunderstorm Sounds are a skill it is forced to be at the bottom. That's the rub, I get that it has to access basically a secondary app to open the skill, but seriously, but having to wait 10mins for the sounds to start which also turns off the Glow is just not right. Can you fix this feature. How was it overlooked? Even for children, parent says "Alexa put childname to sleep"... it turns off the lights, turns on the Glow (nightlight), starts a book/sounds and then X time later, it turns itself all off. I'm fine with adding a "wait" to the routine, but still... the skill issue should be resolved, for this exact concern.Mic/Speaker - Honestly, not a big issue to me. I get how it could be an improvement and useful.No water - See, the Glow would be awesome in a bathroom. or even on a nightstand. But steam might be an issue, the notations were not that specific. Also, people are clumsy and might knock liquids over on a nightstand. A couple rubber seals/gaskets would solve this concern.All in all - It does what they say it does, it should do more I am quite shocked that some of the common sense features are missing. Learning the "Routines" system is a learning curve. It could be so much more though, so update please, I also understand that this is a first run beta/customer review period, I am sure many realize it also, so we wait for the update.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2019

Review Text: wish there were some morepleasing colorsI being an adultbought this on saleknowing  it’s meant as a kids night lightwe usually keep battery powered candles on at night because its a gentle light and good in the event you wake during the night for the restroom or etc  and something like a candle light is pleasantthe colors the glow puts out are for the most part tolerable but  not pleasanti use the red at night  a lot of the other colors are harsh  the red could be better  probably due to the thick white plastic of the glow  the red isn’t horrible at night and it was cheap so ill give it a thumbs upif you can get it cheap  definitely a good buyif you can get it cheap

Review Text: I bought this as an alternative to the many “ready to wake” style lights and clocks. I bought it knowing it was not a speaker and didn’t have a built in microphone. All of that said, it does EXACTLY what I need it to do, plus it has fun extra capabilities I wouldn’t get with a typical ready to wake set up.I use the “routines” function in my Alexa app to set up a “winding down” routine with lavender lighting an hour before bed, so that my first grader and preschooler can look at books or play nicely while I get my infant ready at night. At bedtime, I have a routine that turns the light to a salmon color. The kids know that once the light is red/pink, they can only leave their room for potty or an emergency. This has worked very well! Our morning routine starts with the light turning green and the kids knowing they can come into my room or join me downstairs. Perfect set up for us. We’ve also used the rainbow timer if I need them to play quietly upstairs while I work from home or take a phone call. They enjoy watching the colors change and knowing when their quiet playtime is over.The fun new light show features have been cool to play with, but because we keep this in their room, they’re not missing out by not having an Alexa voice command service in their room to active them. It’s fun to bring the Glow downstairs for “dance parties” or playing pretend with the campfire or fire truck mode, though.Overall I am very pleased with this purchase. I do think it is priced high, but I should have looked for it on Black Friday, I suppose.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020

Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2020
